intro: Operculicarya multijuga, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
